author: Staff Reporter
text:
A police youth brigade member who took money from an accused in a lottery offence cases, and some shopkeepers lost his job. He was supposed to join the police force on Wednesday.

Manikandan (30) of Goundampalayam in Edappadi was working as a youth bridge under Poolampatty Police station.

He, later, served as a driver for the police station inspector Suresh Kumar. Based on complaints against him, the Inspector conducted an inquiry and submitted a report to the Superintendent of Police G. Subbulakshmi. Manikandan was transferred to the District Armed Reserve force.

Additional Superintendent of Police Subramani conducted another inquiry and it was confirmed that Manikandan used to collect money. Other youth brigades who were selected for the police service received orders for training on Wednesday.
title: Youth loses job
